chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
The defendant Billy J. Staves was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:

All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
Administrative Transfer to Treatment Court.
IT IS ORDERED: this case is transferred to Branch 5 while defendant is a participant in the Treatment Court program.  The case will be administratively reassigned back to the initial court upon defendant's successful completion of the Eau Claire County Treatment Court Program, or upon defendant's termination from that program.

Case(s) called at 8:49 AM: 22CF947, 14CF729, Polk Co 14CF75, 14CF74.
Participant appeared with Treatment Court Team.
1st Appearance in Treatment Court.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
on Amendment to Judgment of Conviction.
It is ordered that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days will be determined by the Department of Corrections Records Office staff and will be based upon actual release date.

Dated 04/05/19 from Department of Corrections Warden Jeffrey Pugh to Court regarding defendant's completion of a treatment program and requesting Court to authorize defendant's release and conversion of the remaining confinement time to extended supervision. Enclosed is an Order on Amendment to Judgment of Conviction.
